title: Here is a list of 20 influential articles on zero- and few-shot learning using pre-trained language models (PLMs) up to 2022
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
**"Language Models are Few-Shot Learners"**
**"UnifiedQA: Crossing Format Boundaries with a Single QA System"**
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"GPT-2: Better Language Models and Their Implications"** - Radford et al
**"XLNet: Generalized Autoregressive Pretraining for Language Understanding"** - Yang et al
**"RoBERTa: A Robustly Optimized BERT Pretraining Approach"** - Liu et al
**"ALBERT: A Lite BERT for Self-supervised Learning of Language Representations"**
Pre-training Text Encoders as Discriminators Rather Than Generators"**
**"Few-Shot Text Classification with Distributional Signatures"** - Zhang et al
**"Meta-Learning for Few-Shot Natural Language Processing: A Survey"** - Geng et al
Language Model Pre-training with Hierarchical Supervision"** - Aghajanyan et al
Pattern-Exploiting Training"**
**"Zero-Shot Text Classification with Generative Language Models"** - Yin et al
**"Few-Shot Learning with Contextualized Word Vectors"** - Bao et al
**"Prompt Programming for Large Language Models: Beyond the Few-Shot Paradigm"**
**"Unsupervised Data Augmentation for Consistency Training"** - Xie et al
**"Meta-Learning for Low-Resource Natural Language Generation in Task-Oriented Dialogue Systems"**
**"Few-Shot Learning for Named Entity Recognition in Medical Text"** - Fritzler et al
**"Improving Few-Shot Learning with Auxiliary Self-Supervised Pretext Tasks"**
These articles cover various aspects of zero- and few-shot learning using PLMs, including foundational models, innovative techniques, and applications in different domains
